title.narrative: POLICY AND SUSTAINABILITY

description.narrative: The Government of Angola has increased national capacity to implement and monitor sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Hygiene, Maternal And Newborn Health, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, the most vulnerable boys, girls and families will have access to appropriate water and sanitation facilities and live in open defecation free communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government of Angola has increased national capacity to implement and monitor sustainable WASH services

description.narrative: National Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Sector Coordination Platform (FONAS, in Portuguese) designed and launched in 2019 by the Ministry of Energy and Water (MINEA) and Ministry of Environment (MINAMB), with the technical and financial support from UNICEF. National Strategy on Community-Led Total Sanitation and Schools for Angola, to ending open defecation by 2030 in the country, designed with the technical and financial support from UNICEF, approved by the Council of Ministers (Government of Angola) in 2019. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2020
